data.title: Bertrade de Montfort
data.text:

Bertrade de Montfort

Born: Abt 1155, Normandy, France

Marriage: Hugh Kevelioc Earl of Chester, Vicomté d'Avranches 141

Died: 1227, Evreux, Eure, Normandy, France about age 72 141

Information about this person:

 Background Information. 220

Betrade was the daughter of Simón de Montfort and Maud, and the sister of Amauri comté d'Evreux and Simón lord of Montfort and Rochefort. Betrade married Hugh, Earl of Chester.

~ Cokayne's Complete Peerage, 2nd Edition, (Appendix D), Vol. VII, p. 716

Bertrade married Hugh of Kevelioc in 1169, then being aged 14 (the King giving her away in marriage "because she was his own cousin "), daughter of Simon de Montfort, Count d'Evreux by his 1st wife, Maud. Hugh de Kevelioc died at Leek, Stafford, 30 June 1181, aged about 34 and was buried at St. Werburg's, Chester. Bertrade, his widow, died 1227, aged about 7I.

~ Cokayne's Complete Peerage, 2nd Edition, Vol. III, p. 167, Vol. XIV, p. 170

Bertrade married Hugh Kevelioc Earl of Chester, Vicomté d'Avranches, son of Ranulf de Gernon de Meschines, Earl of Chester and Maud de Caen.220 (Hugh Kevelioc Earl of Chester, Vicomté d'Avranches was born in 1147 in Cyfeiliog, Merionethshire, Wales 191 and died on 30 Jun 1181 in Leeke, Staffordshire, England 191,220.)
